questions.text: The ability of a material to conduct electricity is called its:
In an AC circuit, the instantaneous power varies with time. The average of this instantaneous power over a full cycle is the:
A PN junction diode is formed by joining:

choices.text: A p-type semiconductor with an n-type semiconductor
An intrinsic semiconductor with a metal

questions.text: A CMOS inverter uses:

choices.text: One NMOS and one PMOS transistor

questions.text: In a negative feedback amplifier, the feedback network:

choices.text: Adds a portion of the output signal in phase with the input.
Adds a portion of the output signal out of phase with the input.
Is connected in parallel with the input.

questions.text: A 'Buffer Amplifier' or 'Voltage Follower' using an op-amp has a voltage gain of approximately:
The hexadecimal number system includes digits 0-9 and letters:
What is a 'truth table'?

choices.text: A diagram of a logic circuit.
A table showing the output of a logic circuit for all possible combinations of its inputs.

questions.text: An asynchronous (ripple) counter's speed is limited by the:

choices.text: Cumulative propagation delay of the flip-flops

questions.text: The 'fetch-decode-execute' cycle is the basic operational process of a:
The 8259 is a Programmable Interrupt Controller (PIC) used to:

choices.text: Manage multiple interrupt requests and send a single interrupt to the CPU.

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of the break statement in C?

choices.text: To exit immediately from a loop (for, while, do-while) or a switch statement.
To skip the current iteration of a loop.
To return a value from a function.

questions.text: In C++, an 'inheritance' relationship represents a(n):
What is the difference between opening a file in 'w' mode versus 'a' mode in C?

choices.text: 'w' is for writing, 'a' is for reading.
'w' overwrites the file if it exists, while 'a' appends to the end of the file.
'w' is for text files, 'a' is for binary files.

questions.text: A 'bus contention' occurs when:

choices.text: Multiple devices try to drive the bus at the same time.
The data on the bus is corrupted.
The bus speed is too slow.

questions.text: The 'write-back' cache policy involves writing a modified cache block to main memory:

choices.text: Only when the cache block is about to be replaced.

questions.text: A device driver is a piece of software that:

choices.text: Is part of the application program.
Allows the operating system to communicate with and control a specific hardware device.
Is stored in the hardware device itself.

questions.text: The primary function of the Data Link Layer (Layer 2) is to:

choices.text: Provide a reliable node-to-node data transfer over a physical link.
Manage the physical transmission of bits.

questions.text: A 'port' number in TCP and UDP is used to:

choices.text: Identify a specific host on the network.
Identify a specific process or application running on a host.
Specify the size of the packet.

questions.text: A 'man-in-the-middle' attack is a type of security breach where an attacker:

choices.text: Tries to guess a user's password.
Secretly relays and possibly alters the communication between two parties who believe they are directly communicating.
Installs a virus on a computer.

questions.text: The Chomsky Hierarchy classifies formal languages into four types. Which is the most general (most powerful) type?
What is 'computational complexity'?

choices.text: The study of how difficult it is to write a program.
The study of the resources (like time and memory) required by an algorithm to solve a problem.
The physical complexity of a computer.
The complexity of a user interface.

questions.text: In computer graphics, 'anti-aliasing' is a technique used to:

choices.text: Add jagged edges to lines and polygons.
Reduce the appearance of jagged edges ('jaggies') by smoothing them.
Increase the resolution of an image.
Apply color to a wireframe model.

questions.text: A 'world coordinate system' in computer graphics is used to:

choices.text: Define the coordinate system of the display screen.
Define the coordinate system for a single object.
Provide a common reference frame for all objects in a scene.

questions.text: A 'queue' is a data structure that operates on a:
Which searching algorithm requires the data to be sorted beforehand?
What is a 'deadlock' in the context of database transactions?

choices.text: When two or more transactions are waiting for each other to release locks.
When a transaction is rolled back.

questions.text: 'Paging' is a memory management scheme that allows:

choices.text: The physical address space of a process to be non-contiguous.
A process to be stored in a single, contiguous block of memory.
The CPU to directly access the hard disk.
Processes to share the same address space without protection.

questions.text: What is a 'bug' in software?

choices.text: A feature that was not requested.
An error, flaw, or fault in a computer program that causes it to produce an incorrect or unexpected result.
A slow part of the program.

questions.text: The primary purpose of a 'requirements specification document' is to:

choices.text: Describe the design and architecture of the software.
Provide a detailed description of the system's intended functions and behavior.
List the test cases for the software.

questions.text: In UML, a 'component diagram' is used to model:

choices.text: The interactions between users and the system.
The physical organization of software components and their dependencies.

questions.text: In C++, what is the difference between 'aggregation' and 'composition'?

choices.text: Aggregation implies a weak 'has-a' relationship, while composition implies a strong 'part-of' relationship where the part cannot exist without the whole.
Composition is another name for inheritance.
Aggregation is used for interfaces, while composition is for classes.

questions.text: In the context of search algorithms, 'admissibility' of a heuristic means that the heuristic:

choices.text: Never overestimates the cost to reach the goal.
Always returns the exact cost to the goal.
Guarantees that the search will be fast.

questions.text: The 'inference engine' is the component of an expert system that:

choices.text: Applies the rules to the known facts to deduce new information (performs reasoning).

questions.text: 'Clustering' is a type of:
The 'discount rate' in engineering economics represents the:

choices.text: Interest rate used in discounted cash flow analysis to determine the present value of future cash flows.
Rate at which an asset depreciates.

questions.text: A 'milestone' in a project plan is a:

choices.text: Specific task that needs to be done.
A significant event or point in the project with zero duration.
A member of the project team.

questions.text: The 'triple constraint' of project management refers to the balance between:
An engineer's ethical responsibility for 'confidentiality' means:

choices.text: Keeping the proprietary information of their employer or client confidential.

questions.text: According to the NEC regulations, an engineer's registration can be suspended or revoked for:

choices.text: Failing to join the Nepal Engineers' Association.
Working on a project that is not profitable.

questions.text: The unit of energy is the:
A capacitor blocks _____ and allows _____ to pass.
The setup time of a flip-flop is the minimum time for which the data input must be:

choices.text: Stable after the active clock edge.
Stable before the active clock edge.

questions.text: An operating system 'kernel' is the:

choices.text: Central component of the OS that manages system resources.

questions.text: Which protocol is stateless?
What is a 'parser' in the context of compilers?

choices.text: A program that performs lexical analysis.
A program that checks the syntax of the source code according to a grammar.
A program that generates machine code.
A program that optimizes the code.

questions.text: A 'hash function' takes an input (or 'key') and returns:

choices.text: A sorted version of the input.
A fixed-size string of bytes or an integer.
An encrypted version of the input.

questions.text: In C++, new operator allocates memory from the _____, while local variables are typically allocated on the _____.
What is the 'curse of dimensionality' in machine learning?

choices.text: The difficulty of training a model on a small dataset.
Various phenomena that arise when analyzing data in high-dimensional spaces, such as data becoming sparse.

questions.text: The 'closing phase' of a project involves:

choices.text: Formalizing acceptance of the project deliverables and bringing the project to an orderly end.

questions.text: The ASCII code is a:
The continue statement in C is used to:

choices.text: Skip the rest of the current iteration and proceed to the next iteration of a loop.
Go to a specific labeled statement.

questions.text: What is a 'memory leak'?

choices.text: A situation where memory is allocated dynamically but never deallocated, making it unusable.
A hardware fault in a memory chip.
When the system runs out of memory.

questions.text: The 'critical section' is a part of a program that:

choices.text: Must be executed by only one process at a time.

questions.text: The purpose of a 'gateway' in a network is to:

choices.text: Connect devices within the same local network.
Connect two different networks that use different protocols.

questions.text: What is a 'decidable problem' in computability theory?

choices.text: A problem for which a Turing machine will halt on every input.
A problem that can be solved efficiently.
A problem that has a yes/no answer.

questions.text: The 'Scrum Master' in the Scrum agile framework is responsible for:

choices.text: Ensuring the team adheres to Scrum theory, practices, and rules.

questions.text: The 'Bayes' Rule' is used to calculate:

choices.text: The expected value of a random variable.
The conditional probability of an event based on prior knowledge.

questions.text: 'Earned Value Management' (EVM) is a project management technique for:

choices.text: Measuring project performance and progress in an objective manner.

questions.text: In a BJT, the emitter is always:
A full-wave rectifier is fed with a 230V, 50 Hz AC supply. What is the fundamental ripple frequency at the output?
What is the minimum number of 2-input NAND gates required to implement an XOR gate?

choices.text: The output is undefined and depends on the compiler.

questions.text: A system's virtual address is 32 bits, and its physical address is 24 bits. If the page size is 4 KB, how many entries are there in the page table for a single process? (1 KB = 2^10 bytes)
A web page consists of a 10 KB HTML file and 3 images of 20 KB each. The connection uses persistent HTTP with pipelining. How many round-trip times (RTTs) are needed to fetch the entire page?
What is the composite transformation matrix for rotating a 2D point by 90 degrees counter-clockwise and then scaling it by a factor of 2 in both x and y directions?
For an undirected graph with V vertices, what is the maximum number of edges it can have if it is a simple graph (no self-loops or multiple edges)?
Consider a system using the Optimal Page Replacement algorithm with 3 frames. What is the number of page faults for the reference string: 7, 0, 1, 2, 0, 3, 0, 4, 2, 3?
If you invest Rs. 50,000 today at an annual interest rate of 8% compounded annually, what will be its value after 3 years?

What is the output of the following SQL query, assuming an Employees table with a Salary column?
SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT Salary) FROM Employees;

choices.text: The number of unique salary values.
The number of non-null salary values.

questions.text: A piece of code has two independent if statements in sequence. What is its cyclomatic complexity?
What is the decimal value of the 8-bit 2's complement number 11001100?
A network using CSMA/CD has a bandwidth of 10 Mbps and a maximum propagation delay of 25.6 µs. What is the minimum frame size required to ensure collision detection?
A pushdown automaton (PDA) recognizes a language by:

choices.text: Either final state or empty stack.

questions.text: In machine learning, if a classification model has high 'precision' but low 'recall', it means:

choices.text: The model correctly identifies most of the positive cases but has many false positives.
The model's positive predictions are mostly correct, but it misses many actual positive cases.
The model is highly accurate overall.
The model is performing poorly on both measures.

questions.text: In the basic COCOMO model, what type of project would typically have the highest effort multiplier 'a'?
Which design pattern defines a one-to-many dependency between objects so that when one object changes state, all its dependents are notified and updated automatically?
What is the purpose of a 'namespace' in C++?

choices.text: To provide a scope for identifiers (names of types, functions, variables) to avoid name collisions.

questions.text: What is the Boolean expression for the output F of a 2-to-1 MUX with data inputs I0, I1 and selection line S?
In a project network diagram, what does an arrow represent?
